intro: Orophea laotica, commonly known as the Laotian star-fruit tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Laos and Vietnam. It belongs to the family Garcinieae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. Orophea laotica is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and floral display. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is commonly found in lowland evergreen forests.
